content:
Goat cheese is an excellent choice to pair with sun-dried tomatoes! The tangy creaminess of the cheese complements the chewy, savory flavor of the sun-dried tomatoes perfectly.

Now, let's talk about that grilled chicken marinade! Here are a few ideas that would pair beautifully with sun-dried tomatoes and goat cheese:

1. **Herby Italian-Style Marinade**: Mix together olive oil, minced garlic, chopped fresh rosemary, thyme, and oregano, salt, and pepper. This will give your grilled chicken a fragrant, herbaceous flavor that will complement the earthy sweetness of the sun-dried tomatoes.
2. **Lemon-Herb Marinade**: Combine lemon juice, olive oil, minced garlic, chopped fresh parsley, salt, and pepper. The brightness of the lemon will cut through the richness of the goat cheese and sun-dried tomatoes, while the parsley adds a fresh, herbaceous note.
3. **Balsamic Glaze Marinade**: Whisk together balsamic glaze, olive oil, minced garlic, and salt. The sweet-and-sour flavor of the balsamic glaze will enhance the sweetness of the sun-dried tomatoes and pair nicely with the tangy goat cheese.
4. **Mediterranean-Style Marinade**: Mix together olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, chopped Kalamata olives, artichoke hearts, and oregano. This marinade will transport your taste buds to the Mediterranean, with the brininess of the olives and artichoke hearts pairing nicely with the sun-dried tomatoes and goat cheese.
5. **Spicy Italian-Style Marinade**: Combine olive oil, minced garlic, diced jalapeño, chopped fresh basil, salt, and pepper. The spicy kick from the jalapeño will add a nice contrast to the richness of the goat cheese and sun-dried tomatoes.

These marinades will give your grilled chicken a delicious flavor that will pair beautifully with the sun-dried tomatoes and goat cheese in your pasta salad. Feel free to experiment and adjust the ingredients to your taste!

Which one of these marinades catches your eye, or do you have any other flavor combinations in mind?
